title: Note
content:
This is my mother. [She|He|It] is very kind. [She|He|It] likes to cook. 

That man over there is my father. [He|She|It] is a teacher. [He|She|It] teaches math. 

We have a pet dog. [It|He|She] is very playful. [It|He|She] likes to run in the park. (Note: We often use 'It' for animals when distinct gender isn't emphasized, though pet owners might use He/She).

1. **Mother**: Female -> **She**.
2. **Father**: Male -> **He**.
3. **Dog**: Animal -> **It** (generally).

title: Assuming
content:
Look at the doctor. [He|She|It] is wearing a white coat. (Assuming the picture shows a man). The nurse is helping the patient. [She|He|It] is very gentle. (Assuming the picture shows a woman). 

The hospital is new. [It|He|She] is very big. My car is parked outside. [It|He|She] is red.
explanationEnUs:
# ðŸ¥ Jobs and Objects

1. **Male Doctor**: **He**.
2. **Female Nurse**: **She**.
3. **Hospital**: Building/Object -> **It**.
4. **Car**: Object -> **It**.

title: Mary
content:
My best friend is Mary. [She|He|It] is a student. [She|He|It] studies hard every day. 

I also have a friend named John. [He|She|It] plays basketball. [He|She|It] is very tall. 

I have a new phone. [It|He|She] takes great photos. I love [it|he|she] very much.
explanationEnUs:
# ðŸ‘« Friends and Objects

1. **Mary**: Female -> **She**.
2. **John**: Male -> **He**.
3. **Phone**: Object -> **It**.

title: Cruise
content:
Tom Cruise is an actor. [He|She|It] is very famous. Brad Pitt is also an actor. [He|She|It] has blonde hair. 

Angelina Jolie is an actress. [She|He|It] is beautiful. Meryl Streep is a legend. [She|He|It] acts very well. 

The movie is exciting. [It|He|She] is two hours long.
explanationEnUs: Male -> He, Female -> She, Movie -> It.

title: Mike
content:
I have a brother named Mike. [He|She|It] is older than me. I have a sister named Lisa. [She|He|It] is younger. 

We share a room. [It|He|She] is quite big. My brother has a bike. [It|He|She] is blue.
explanationZhTw: Brother -> He, Sister -> She, Room/Bike -> It.
explanationEnUs: Brother -> He, Sister -> She, Room/Bike -> It.
explanationZhCn: Brother -> He, Sister -> She, Room/Bike -> It.

title: Smith
content:
Mr. Smith is my boss. [He|She|It] is strict. Ms. Jones is the secretary. [She|He|It] is helpful. 

The computer is broken. [It|He|She] needs fixing. The printer is new. [It|He|She] is fast.
explanationZhTw: Mr. -> He, Ms. -> She, Computer/Printer -> It.
explanationEnUs: Mr. -> He, Ms. -> She, Objects -> It.
explanationZhCn: Mr. -> He, Ms. -> She, Computer/Printer -> It.

title: Animals
content:
The cow is eating grass. [It|He|She] looks happy. (Animals generally It). The farmer is busy. [He|She|It] is working hard. (Assuming farmer is male).

The tractor is old. [It|He|She] is rusty. The barn is red. [It|He|She] is full of hay.
explanationZhTw: Cow -> It, Farmer (Male) -> He, Tractor/Barn -> It.
explanationEnUs: Cow -> It, Farmer (Male) -> He, Objects -> It.
explanationZhCn: Cow -> It, Farmer (Male) -> He, Tractor/Barn -> It.

title: Mom
content:
Where is the knife? [It|He|She] is on the table. Where is Mom? [She|He|It] is cooking. Where is Dad? [He|She|It] is washing dishes.

The soup fits well. [It|He|She] tastes good.
explanationZhTw: Knife/Soup -> It, Mom -> She, Dad -> He.
explanationEnUs: Objects -> It, Mom -> She, Dad -> He.
explanationZhCn: Knife/Soup -> It, Mom -> She, Dad -> He.

title: Boy
content:
Look at that boy running. [He|She|It] is fast. Look at that girl swinging. [She|He|It] is happy. 

The slide is high. [It|He|She] looks fun. The tree is tall. [It|He|She] is old.
explanationZhTw: Boy -> He, Girl -> She, Slide/Tree -> It.
explanationEnUs: Boy -> He, Girl -> She, Objects -> It.
explanationZhCn: Boy -> He, Girl -> She, Slide/Tree -> It.

title: Lee
content:
I have a pen. [It|He|She] is blue. The teacher is Mr. Lee. [He|She|It] is writing. The student is Sarah. [She|He|It] is reading.

The book is heavy. [It|He|She] has many pages.
explanationZhTw: Pen/Book -> It, Mr. Lee -> He, Sarah -> She.
explanationEnUs: Objects -> It, Male -> He, Female -> She.
explanationZhCn: Pen/Book -> It, Mr. Lee -> He, Sarah -> She.

title: King
content:
The King wears a crown. [He|She|It] is powerful. The Queen sits next to him. [She|He|It] is elegant.

The castle is huge. [It|He|She] is made of stone. The crown is gold. [It|He|She] is shiny.
explanationZhTw: King -> He, Queen -> She, Castle/Crown -> It.
explanationEnUs: King -> He, Queen -> She, Objects -> It.
explanationZhCn: King -> He, Queen -> She, Castle/Crown -> It.

title: Sun
content:
The sun is hot. [It|He|She] is shining. Mr. Sun is a character. [He|She|It] smiles. (Personified).

The rain is falling. [It|He|She] is wet. The wind is blowing. [It|He|She] is cold.

title: Dress
content:
This dress is pretty. [It|He|She] is pink. That boy likes the shirt. [He|She|It] wants to buy it.

The saleswoman is helpful. [She|He|It] smiles. The hat fits well. [It|He|She] is stylish.
explanationZhTw: Dress/Hat -> It, Boy -> He, Saleswoman -> She.
explanationEnUs: Objects -> It, Boy -> He, Saleswoman -> She.
explanationZhCn: Dress/Hat -> It, Boy -> He, Saleswoman -> She.

title: Chen
content:
My head hurts. [It|He|She] aches. My doctor is Dr. Chen (female). [She|He|It] helps me.

My leg is broken. [It|He|She] is in a cast. My brother is sad. [He|She|It] cries.
explanationZhTw: Head/Leg -> It, Dr. Chen (å¥³) -> She, Brother -> He.
explanationEnUs: Body parts -> It, Female Dr -> She, Male -> He.
explanationZhCn: Head/Leg -> It, Dr. Chen (å¥³) -> She, Brother -> He.

title: Bed
content:
My bed is soft. [It|He|She] is comfortable. My sister sleeps here. [She|He|It] is tired.

The lamp is bright. [It|He|She] is on. My dad reads here too. [He|She|It] likes this room.
explanationZhTw: Bed/Lamp -> It, Sister -> She, Dad -> He.
explanationEnUs: Objects -> It, Sister -> She, Dad -> He.
explanationZhCn: Bed/Lamp -> It, Sister -> She, Dad -> He.
